import seaborn as sns
source.92a213e4:
df["GDP per capita"] = df["GDP per capita"].map(convert_str_with_commma2int)
df["GDP growth"] = df["GDP growth"].map(convert_str_with_percent2float)
df["Inflation rate"] = df["Inflation rate"].map(convert_str_with_percent2float)
df["Unemployed rate"] = df["Unemployed rate"].map(convert_str_with_percent2float)
df["Government debt"] = df["Government debt"].map(convert_str_with_percent2float)
df["Total Investment"] = df["Total Investment"].map(convert_str_with_percent2float)
source.6b11157e:
g_gdp = sns.lineplot(x="Year", y="GDP ", data=df)
g_gdp.set_ylabel('GDP(bn. US$)')
g_gdp.set_title("Transition of GDP(bn. US$)")

source.3a7c7721:
### Data explanation

**Year**: Indicator Years

**GDP**: In bn. US$ Purchasing power parity(PPP)

**GDP per capita**: In US$ Purchasing power parity(PPP)

**GDP growth**: Real GDP growth

**Inflation rate**: in Percent(%)

**Unemployed rate**: in Percent(%)

**Government debt**: in % of GDP

**Total Investment**: Total investment in % of GDP
source.7a57f01c: Bangladesh is the country located in South Asia and borders India to the north and east and west on three sides, and Myanmar to the southeast. Bangladesh is one of the world's fastest-growing economies. In this notebook, we gain a better insight of Bangladesh's economy by analyze the data.
